answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens from conflict zones can go to employment agencies to register and find a job, even if they do not have qualification or experience documents.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: Registration for employment in Romania is done with an identity document.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can complete the statement on their own responsibility with the help of a counselor, or if they find an employer directly, they can complete it together with the employer.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: The Jobs4Ukraine platform supports people affected by the war in Ukraine by providing easy access to job opportunities abroad and remote via a free platform.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Job search on the Jobs4Ukraine platform'.

answers.answer: The National Agency for Employment, through its territorial structures, offers several free services to Ukrainian citizens registered with the NAE.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Free services offered to Ukrainian citizens for their integration into the Romanian labour market'.

answers.answer: The employment agency's guide provides information on how to look for a job in Romania, including advice on creating a resume, preparing for interviews, and the rules for completing documents for work in this country.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Employment Guide from the National Employment Agency of Romania'.

answers.answer: The guide for migrants and temporary protected persons offers a thorough introduction to the Romanian employment system, providing important resources and an understanding of the legal aspects for finding a job.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Guidance on access to the labor market'.

answers.answer: Organizations provide assistance with employment, resume writing, consultations on labor rights and legislation, and other aspects for Ukrainian refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Organizations Providing Support in Employment for Refugees'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can find jobs using the Adecco platform, which helps them find jobs where needed and operates in both Ukrainian and English languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Jobs for Ukrainian Refugees in Romania'.

answers.answer: For job search assistance from Ateliere Fără Frontiere, applications can be submitted by email to cariere@atelierefarafrontiere.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Job search assistance from Ateliere Fără Frontiere'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can learn more about integration into the Romanian community and labor market by finding out about refugee employment initiatives and services for professional integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Find out more about integration into the Romanian community'.
